title: Jacqueline Jossa appears delighted as she larks around with her beloved husband Dan Osborne
text:
They've had their fair share of ups and downs since tying the knot in 2017.

But Jacqueline Jossa and husband Dan Osborne enjoyed a happy family day out at Legoland on Saturday with daughter Ella, four and Dan's son Teddy, five.

The former EastEnders actress, 26, and ex-TOWIE star, 28, were beaming as they took their kids on the Coastguard water ride.

Putting the past behind them: Jacqueline Jossa and husband Dan Osborne enjoyed a happy family day out at Legoland on Saturday with daughter Ella, four and Dan's other son Teddy, five

Jacqueline, who rocked a casual look in a blue sweater and denim jeans, pumped her fist triumphantly as she joined in the fun while standing next to Dan.

She paired the look with a cute white bag as she raised both her arms and cheered as Dan laughed behind her and young Teddy grinned.

The parents steered separate boats down the waterway, with Jacqueline and little Ella in a red one and Dan with Teddy - who he has with ex Megan Tomlin - in a boat.

Elsewhere, Dan rested his hand on Teddy's head as the little boy steered and new businesswoman Jacqueline and Ella cheered as they approached Dan who took a snap on his phone.

Easy does it: The former EastEnders actress, 26, and ex-TOWIE star were beaming as they took their kids on the Coastguard water ride

The kids can drive: Dan and Jacqueline were beaming as they helped their children to pilot the Lego boats

The happy day out comes following a turbulent year for the couple after Dan was alleged to have been caught kissing Love Island star Alexandra Cane something the reality stars both vehemently denied.

And in April the former TOWIE star was spotted partying with blonde PA, Steph Ledigo, in LA with both parties denying they are anything more than friends.

But talking about her marriage to new! magazine, Jacqueline insisted that their relationship is 'strong' as she added: 'We always have been. It's hard to explain it because no one would understand until you're living it...

Wow! Jacqueline wore a cute white bag as she raised both her arms and cheered as Dan laughed behind her and young Teddy grinned

Fatherly fun: Dan rested his hand on Teddy's head as the little boy steered down the waterway

'All I can say is that I know where I'm at and he knows where he's at. I'm still learning, he's still learning...

'We are very young. We are young to have three kids. It's a work in progress and nothing is perfect. We are still working on stuff.'

Jacqueline left her role as Lauren on Eastenders last year and in September she launched a performing arts academy in Bexleyheath, Kent.

The Jac Jossa Academy provides classes for a pre-school age group from three to six years, middle class from five to eight-years-old, and a top class group from nine to 12 and above.

We made it: Jacqueline and Ella cheered as they approached Dan who took a snap on his phone

New career: Jacqueline left her role as Lauren on Eastenders last year and in September she launched a performing arts academy in Bexleyheath, Kent
description: Jacqueline Jossa and husband Dan Osborne enjoyed a happy family day out at Legoland on Saturday with daughter Ella, four and Dan's other son Teddy, five.
